data.text: Descript 1 videodisc (approximately 90 min.) : sound, color with black and white sequences ; 4 3/4 in. two-dimensional moving image tdi rdacontent video v rdamedia videodisc vd rdacarrier DVD video 4 3/4 in. rda digital optical surround Dolby Digital 5.1 rda videodisc laser optical NTSC rda video file DVD video region 1 rda Motion picture. Note Based on: Stonewall : the riots that sparked the gay revolution by David Carter Originally produced in 2011 Contents Homosexuality in the 1960s -- Social and legal consequences -- Paradise in Greenwich Village -- Dodging the authorities -- A time of rebellion -- An uprising at Stonewall -- Strength in numbers -- A movement is born -- The first gay pride parade Credits Edited by Kate Davis ; filmed by Buddy Squires ; music composed by Gary Lionelli Note Originally broadcast as an episode of the television program The American Experience Summary Explores the dramatic event that launched a worldwide rights movement. When police raided a Mafia-run gay bar in Greenwich Village, the Stonewall Inn on June 28, 1969, gay men and women did something they had not done before: they fought back. As the streets of New York erupted into violent protests and street demonstrations, the collective anger announced that the gay rights movement had arrived Audience Grade 7 to Adult. Not rated. System Det DVD, NTSC, region 1; widescreen; 5.1 surround Note English subtitles for the deaf and hard of hearing Subject Carter, David, 1952-2020 -- Television adaptations. Stonewall Riots, New York, N.Y., 1969. Gay liberation movement -- United States -- History. Homosexuality -- United States -- History -- 20th century. Gay liberation movement -- United States. Genre Documentary television programs. Nonfiction television programs. Television adaptations. Video recordings for the hearing impaired. Historical television programs.
